task.title: Scaling Group Detail - General
task.shortdesc: This dialog allows you to view and edit a scaling group. An Auto Scaling group defines the parameters for the Eucalyptus instances that are used for scaling, as well as the minimum, maximum, and (optionally) the desired number of instances to use for Auto Scaling your application. For more information on Auto Scaling, please see Using Auto Scaling in the Eucalyptus User Guide.

task.title: Capacity
task.shortdesc: This section is where you specify the minimum, maximum, and average number of instances your scaling group will keep running.

step.cmd: Select the maximum number of instances you want running in your autoscaling group using the Maximum control.
Specify the minimum number of instances you want running using the Minimum control.
Specify the desired number of instances you want running using the Desired control.

A termination policy defines how instances that are no longer needed in the scaling group are terminated. Select one or more termination policies from the Termination policies drop-down list box. The termination policies will be executed in the order you select them.

task.title: Details
task.shortdesc: A tag is a key/value pair containing data that you can attach to resources in your cloud. This section of the Create Scaling Group wizard allows you to define tags for for your scaling group and for instances that run in your scaling group.

step.cmd: Select a launch configuration from the Launch Configuration drop-down list box. A launch configuration defines the properties of the instances that are launched as part of your auto scaling group.
Select the availability zone for your new scaling group from the Availability zones drop-down list box.
step.info: You can add another availability zone to the new auto scaling group by clicking the + button next to the drop-down list box.

step.cmd: The cooldown period is the number of seconds after a scaling activity completes before any new scaling activity can start. Use the Default cooldown period (seconds) control to select the cooldown period for your auto scaling group.

task.title: Health Check
task.shortdesc: In this section, you can specify load balancers, availability zones, and health checks for the instances that run in your auto scaling group.

step.cmd: Select the type of health check for your auto scaling group from the Type drop-down list box. The auto scaling health check uses EC2 instance status checks to determine the health state of each instance in your auto scaling group. If your auto scaling group is using a load balancer, auto scaling will use both EC2 instance status checks and load balancing instance health checks.

Type the amount of grace period, in seconds, into the Grace period text box. This is the amount of time after a new instance is launched in your auto scaling group before health checks start for the instance.

task.title: Tags
task.shortdesc: A tag is a key/value pair containing data that you can attach to resources in your cloud. This section of the Create Scaling Group wizard allows you to define tags for for your scaling group and for instances that run in your scaling group.

step.cmd: If you want to apply the new tag to instances running in the scaling group, select the Propagate check box.
Type the key name for your tag into the Key text box.
Type the value for your tag into the Value text box.
If you wish to add additional tags, click the Add Tag button.
If you wish to delete a tag that you've already entered, click the x on the tag icon.
Once you're satisfied with the edits to your scaling group, click the Save changes button.
